page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND INTRODUCTION
page.content: This section lies 22km north of Dumfries and covers part of the Thornhill basin of the River Nith. The flat, flood plain takes up the middle of the section and to the east and west the land rises in gentle slopes to a max. height of 200m. Beyond the section the land rises steeply affording magnificent views of the Lowthers in the east and the Keir Hills in the west. The scenery is a pleasant combination of well worked farmland, moorland and mixed woodland. Dairying is the mainstay of the farms but some crops are also grown both as fodders for the cattle and to sell. In addition to a dense farm settlement the section includes the villages of Thornhill (pop. 1520) and Penpont (330). Thornhill is the local service centre.
